excerpt: Museum of Galician aristocracy from the 18th to the 20th centuries, with furniture, art & more.
detail_description: Museo Quiñones de León, located in Castrelos park, is a traditional stately mansion turned into a museum showcasing the Galician aristocracy from the 18th to the 20th centuries. The museum features furniture, art, and valuable archaeological pieces that offer insight into the region's past. Visitors can explore rooms adorned with period furniture, lamps, and rugs while admiring one of the finest collections of Galician painting.
name: Museo Quiñones de León
address: Camiño Corredoura, 41, 36213 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

excerpt: Casco Vello is Vigo’s old town, filled with Renaissance-era architecture and centered on fresco-filled, 19th-century Concatedral de Santa María church. Stone steps lead up Rua Baixada O Forte to a hilltop garden and lookout over the harbor, and cobbled lanes open onto Plaza de la Constitución, framed by grand arcades lined with artisan stores. Open-air tavernas serve Galician dishes such as octopus in paprika.
detail_description: Casco Vello, also known as Vigo's old town, is a charming area filled with Renaissance-era architecture and historical landmarks. Visitors can explore the 19th-century Concatedral de Santa María church and stroll through cobbled lanes that lead to Plaza de la Constitución, where artisan stores and open-air tavernas offer traditional Galician dishes. The area comes alive during summer fiestas celebrating local specialties like sardines, cornbread, and octopus.
name: Casco Vello
address: Vigo, 36202 Municipality of Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Parque Monte do Castro is a stunning park surrounding the El Castro fortress, featuring gardens, terraces, and shaded paths. The park offers panoramic views of the city from its mountain top location. Visitors can explore an Iberian settlement with Bronze Age dwellings on the lower slope. It's a great option for those who prefer a less strenuous experience compared to the nearby fortress.
name: Parque Monte do Castro
address: paseo cedros, s/n, Freixeiro, 36203 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

excerpt: Contemporary-art museum with works by local & international artists, plus rotating exhibitions.
detail_description: MARCO, the Museum of Contemporary Art in Vigo, is a must-visit for art enthusiasts. The museum showcases an impressive collection of works by both local and international artists, with rotating exhibitions that keep the experience fresh for returning visitors. While exploring Vigo, consider joining a free walking tour led by local guides to discover the city's highlights, including the iconic MARCO museum. Other notable museums in the area include the Galician Museum of the Sea and the House of the Arts.
name: MARCO (Museo de Arte Contemporáneo)
address: Rúa do Príncipe, 54, Santiago de Vigo, 36202 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Monte O Castro is located in the Fragoso valley, surrounded by Mount Penide, Mount Cela, the Fragoselo Mountains and the Sierra de Galineiro. The city's growth has expanded towards the valley and coastline due to population increase. Visitors can explore an ancient Celtic settlement at the top of O Castro with reconstructed stone buildings. Additionally, history enthusiasts can visit the Salinae Roman saltworks.
name: Monte O Castro
address: Vigo, 36203 Municipality of Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

excerpt: Contemporary maritime museum offering natural, cultural, industrial & historical exhibits.
detail_description: The Museo do Mar de Galicia is a contemporary museum showcasing natural, cultural, industrial and historical exhibits. Its modern architecture seamlessly blends with the surrounding environment situated between two beaches and leading to a lighthouse. The building also houses a cafe/restaurant serving delicious dishes. The permanent exhibition offers insights into the Galician fishing industry throughout different periods of time while also addressing geopolitical changes that have affected it.
name: Museo do Mar de Galicia
address: Av. da Atlántida, 160, 36208 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

excerpt: Sandy 1.2-km. city beach backed by a paved promenade, with seasonal lifeguards & sports facilities.
detail_description: Praia de Samil is the largest and most popular beach in Vigo, Spain. This 1.2-km stretch of white sandy beach has been a local favorite since the late 1960s. It offers modern amenities such as public swimming pools, a skating rink, cafes, picnic areas, and public restrooms. The area also features a paved promenade with plenty of parking nearby. Visitors can enjoy activities like beach volleyball and relax at tapas bars along the coast.
name: Praia de Samil
address: 36212, Spain

detail_description: After exploring the Basilica of Santa Maria, take a short 3-minute stroll to Praza Porta do Sol. This square derived its name from being the former entrance to the walled town. Notable features include sculptures of Dinoseto and El Sireno, iconic figures representing the city's heritage.
name: Praza Porta do Sol
address: Vigo, 36202 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

excerpt: Vigo is a city on Spain’s northwest coast. The mouth of the nearby Vigo Estuary is sheltered by the Cíes Islands, which form part of the Atlantic Islands National Park. The Cíes are known for their rich birdlife and crescent-shaped Rodas Beach. The city’s old quarter is home to the neoclassical Church of Santa María. The Castro de Vigo archaeological site has reconstructed ancient dwellings.
detail_description: Vigo is a coastal city in Spain, known for its proximity to the Cíes Islands and the Atlantic Islands National Park. The area is famous for its birdlife and stunning Rodas Beach. The city's old quarter features the neoclassical Church of Santa María, while the Castro de Vigo archaeological site showcases reconstructed ancient dwellings.
name: Vigo
address: Municipality of Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

excerpt: Small, traditional zoo featuring diverse mammals, reptiles & birds & a nocturnal exhibit.
detail_description: Vigozoo, also known as Zoo de Vigo, is a small traditional zoo located about 10km from the city center. It is nestled in the beautiful surroundings of mount A Guia and offers a diverse range of mammals, reptiles, and birds. The zoo features an interesting nocturnal exhibit that showcases animals during their active nighttime hours. Visitors can enjoy various activities and educational programs suitable for all ages throughout the year.
name: Vigozoo
address: Plaza de Los Leones, s/n, Teis, 36316 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: The Port of Vigo is renowned as one of the world's most exceptional natural ports, with a rich history dating back to Roman times. This maritime hub has played a pivotal role in the development of Vigo, giving rise to modern marinas, a transatlantic harbor, and thriving fishing and canning industries.
name: Port of Vigo
address: Spain

excerpt: Expansive local beach known for its fine white sand, adjacent park & numerous cafes & eateries.
detail_description: Playa del Vao is a popular beach in Vigo, known for its long stretch of golden sand and picturesque coastal landscape. It attracts a younger crowd who enjoy activities like soccer, windsurfing, and sailing. The powdery white sand and calm waters make it perfect for sunbathing and family outings. Nearby, Samil Beach offers an expansive shoreline and recreational areas for relaxation and water sports.
name: Playa del Vao
address: Spain

detail_description: Rúa Pescadería, situated near the port in Vigo, is a bustling street renowned for its top-notch seafood dining options. The area is teeming with fish and seafood restaurants, offering an array of delectable dishes. Notably, it's known for hosting the finest ostreras (shuckers), where visitors can indulge in fresh oysters from 10:30am to 3:30pm.
name: Rúa Pescadería
address: Vigo, 36202 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

excerpt: Set along the Vigo Estuary, Bouzas is a commercial port area that’s 36 km from the border with Portugal. It’s home to green spaces and sandy Bouzas Beach, along with shops, cafes, and trendy tapas bars. There’s also an aquarium, plus maritime exhibits and a lighthouse at the Museum of the Sea of Galicia. The port itself offers a popular walking promenade, the Paseo dos Peixes viewpoint, marinas, and yacht clubs.
detail_description: Bouzas is a charming commercial port area located along the Vigo Estuary, just 36 km from the Portuguese border. The town boasts Bouzas Beach, offering sandy shores and green spaces, as well as a variety of shops, cafes, and trendy tapas bars. Visitors can explore an aquarium and maritime exhibits at the Museum of the Sea of Galicia, which also features a lighthouse.
name: Bouzas
address: Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

excerpt: Lively, arty El Ensanche is popular for walks on the chic oceanfront esplanade, with its monument to French novelist Jules Verne. Sculptures dot the landscaped Alameda da Praza de Compostela park, and stately 19th-century Teatro Afundación hosts opera and classical concerts. Stores and market stalls sell Galician cheese, wine, and pastries, while dining options range from snug tavernas to upscale seafood bistros.
detail_description: El Ensanche is a lively and artistic neighborhood known for its chic oceanfront esplanade, Alameda da Praza de Compostela park with sculptures, and the stately 19th-century Teatro Afundación. Visitors can explore market stalls selling Galician cheese, wine, and pastries while enjoying dining options ranging from cozy tavernas to upscale seafood bistros.
name: El Ensanche
address: Vigo, Municipality of Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: La Calle de las Ostras, located near Rua Pescaderia, is renowned for its focus on oysters. This street is even more well-known than its neighboring Rua Pescaderia and offers markets where visitors can purchase fresh oysters as well as restaurants that specialize in serving this delectable seafood.
name: la calle de las ostras
address: Rúa Cánovas del Castillo, 22, 36202 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Praza da Constitución is a vibrant central square in Vigo, surrounded by bustling cafes and traditional craft shops offering goods like hats, baskets, and lace. The nearby streets are filled with tapas restaurants serving local delicacies such as octopus a feira and filloas.
name: Praza da Constitución
address: Vigo, 36202 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Parque de Castrelos, also home to Parque Quinones de Leon, is a must-visit destination in Vigo. The park offers stunning gardens, a beautiful mansion, and various attractions for everyone to enjoy. It's a peaceful place with picturesque views and plenty of ruins to explore. Visitors can admire old trees, a calm river, and beautiful birds while enjoying the shade on sunny days. There are amenities like a playground for kids and ample street parking available.
name: Parque de Castrelos
address: Av. de Castrelos, 186, 36210 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Castro de Vigo is a pre-Roman settlement with circular thatch-roofed dwellings dating back to the 3rd century BCE. It has been partially reconstructed and offers limited opening hours for visitors to enjoy a decent view of the area. The site provides a fantastic opportunity for leisurely walks, offering peaceful and relaxing surroundings with panoramic views of Vigo from above. Visitors can explore the area on foot or drive up halfway before strolling around.
name: Castro de Vigo
address: Paseo Cronista Xosé M. Álvarez Blázquez, 16, Freijeiro, 36203 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

excerpt: Neoclassical church with a simple facade built in the 1800s, with frescoes & barrel-vaulted ceiling.
detail_description: Concatedral - Basílica de Santa María de Vigo is a neoclassical church with a simple facade, adorned with frescoes and featuring a barrel-vaulted ceiling. Nestled in the old town center, its unassuming exterior gives way to a stunning mosaic interior. The architecture and tile decoration bear resemblance to those of neighboring Portugal due to their historical ties.
name: Concatedral - Basílica de Santa María de Vigo
address: Praza Igrexa, 10, 36202 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

excerpt: Alley lined with seafood restaurants offering freshly shucked oysters & souvenir stalls.
detail_description: Mercado da Pedra, located in the historic town center, is a bustling market known for its extensive selection of seafood. The market houses several eateries offering fresh oysters and other seafood delicacies at reasonable prices. In addition to seafood, the market also offers local specialty items and deli products. Visitors can explore nearby shopping streets with unique Galician crafts and products. The area is lined with seafood restaurants and souvenir shops, providing a lively atmosphere for visitors to enjoy.
name: Mercado da Pedra
address: Praza da Pedra, 36202 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Estadio de Balaídos is the home ground of RC Celta Vigo, also known as Celta. Situated in the Balaidos neighborhood just south of Vigo's city center, this stadium can accommodate 29,000 spectators. The ongoing renovation aims to modernize it gradually, with completed upgrades to the Grandstand stand and Rio area. Despite needing further improvements, visitors appreciate its atmosphere and facilities. The stadium's location allows for easy access and minimal queues for amenities.
name: Estadio de Balaídos
address: Av. de Balaídos, s/n, Coia, 36210 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Praia de Bouzas is a beautiful and well-maintained urban beach located in Vigo, Spain. It offers stunning views, crystal-clear waters, and soft sand for visitors to enjoy. The area also features a promenade, parks, cafes, a charming church, and historic streets. While some shade may be lacking on sunny days, the overall experience is highly praised.
name: Praia de Bouzas
address: 36208, Spain

name: Castelo de San Sebastián
address: Subida Barranco, 16, 36202 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

excerpt: Wooded hilltop home to a restored, 16th-century hermitage & known for city, estuary & sunset views.
detail_description: Nestled on the outskirts of the city, Monte da Guia is a serene hilltop retreat that boasts breathtaking panoramic views of the coast and surrounding countryside. This tranquil spot is perfect for those looking to escape the hustle and bustle of urban life. Visitors can embark on a scenic hike to its summit, where they can enjoy picturesque vistas while savoring a delightful picnic. The journey includes fascinating sights like reconstructed Celtic ruins and historical artifacts such as giant anchors and an old cannon along the way.
name: Monte da Guía
address: Av. de Dona Fermina, Teis, 36207 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

excerpt: Bustling, waterfront Bouzas is dominated by the Paseo Marítimo boardwalk, popular for its sunset views, public artworks, and street performances. The dining scene covers upscale marina restaurants, while casual tapas bars with harbor views are popular for evening beers and salt-cod croquettes. Craftspeople sell Vigo’s renowned woven baskets and jewelry with Galician-Celtic motifs at the weekly Alameda flea market.
detail_description: Bouzas is a lively waterfront area known for its bustling Paseo Marítimo boardwalk, offering stunning sunset views and featuring street performances and public artworks. The dining options range from upscale marina restaurants to casual tapas bars with harbor views, perfect for enjoying evening beers and salt-cod croquettes. Visitors can explore Vigo's famous woven baskets and jewelry with Galician-Celtic motifs at the weekly Alameda flea market, where local craftspeople showcase their work.
name: Bouzas
address: Vigo, 36208 Municipality of Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Nestled in the center of the city, Castrelos Park covers around 60 hectares, inviting guests to enjoy its peaceful atmosphere and stunning natural scenery.
name: castrelos Park
address: 36201 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Salinae - Centro Arqueolóxico do Areal is a significant archaeological site in Vigo, offering a glimpse into the ancient Roman period. It is the only preserved marine saltwork area from that era, showcasing how the Romans utilized pool surfaces to produce salt. The museum provides a clear explanation of the historical importance of salt pans and salt. Visitors can immerse themselves in the incredible stories of Roman industry while exploring the well-organized exhibits.
name: Salinae - Centro Arqueolóxico do Areal
address: R. de Rosalía de Castro, 21, Santiago de Vigo, 36201 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

excerpt: Known as the "Fish Man," this landmark steel sculpture by Francisco Leiro is said to guard the port.
detail_description: O Sereo is a famous steel sculpture in Vigo, known as the 'Fish Man,' created by Francisco Leiro. It stands in Plaza Porta do Sol and represents Galician culture. The area around it is perfect for breakfast and people-watching, with a vibrant atmosphere. While some find the statue beautiful, others consider it ugly but still acknowledge its significance as a reference point in the city center.
name: O Sereo
address: Praza Porta do Sol, 36202 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Barco Isla de Ons Portonovo offers a trip to the stunning archipelago of Isla de Ons, just off the coast of Sanxenxo. The protected natural areas are home to diverse plant and animal species. Visitors can take a boat trip with Cruceros Rias Baixas to explore the mussel beds in the Pontevedra estuary, where they can learn about mussel cultivation and even see the submerged part from underwater viewing areas on the boat.
name: Barco Isla de Ons Portonovo
address: Rua Rafael Pico, 5, 36970 Portonovo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Monumento aos cabalos is a stunning sculpture located in Vigo, featuring five horses designed by sculptor Juan Oliveira in 1991. The monument stands at a height of 18 meters and weighs 40 tons, creating an impressive sight as the horses appear to gallop through a spiral waterfall. Situated in a bustling roundabout, it can be challenging to view up close due to the surrounding traffic.
name: Monumento aos cabalos
address: Praza de España, Santiago de Vigo, 36203 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Billeteira Mar de Ons - Estación Marítima de Vigo is highly recommended for its excellent communication and accommodating staff. Despite a cancellation due to weather conditions, the situation was handled well with a refund and the opportunity to rebook for the next day. The ferry service to Cies Island during winter is praised, with travelers enjoying complimentary cider and Roscon de Reyes on their journey back. Customers appreciate the professional service, smooth online experience, and helpful in-person ticket purchase.
name: Billeteira Mar de Ons - Estación Marítima de Vigo
address: Rúa Cánovas del Castillo, 26, bajo 3, 36201 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Sargadelos is a charming village on the Costa Lucence, known for its historic Royal Ceramics Factory that operated until 1860. The ceramics from Sargadelos are highly praised for their original and beautiful designs, including blue and white tableware, masks, fishermen figures, and lighthouses. Visitors can explore a comprehensive collection at the local store where friendly staff members offer insights into the products.
name: Sargadelos
address: Rúa Colón, 29, Santiago de Vigo, 36201 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

name: Senda da Auga
address: Cño. Fonte das Mozas, 20, Teis, 36216 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: In Vigo, Spain, the Monumento a Jules Verne is a must-see attraction. The monument features a sculpture of the famous author sitting on the tentacles of a sea creature, inspired by his novel "20,000 Leagues Under the Sea," which mentions the treasures of sunken galleons in the Bay of Vigo. Nearby, visitors can also take selfies with the El Sireno mermaid statue.
name: Monumento a Jules Verne
address: 36202 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

name: Praia da Fontaíña
address: Rúa de Canido, 24, 36331 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

excerpt: Remains of a high-end Roman villa dating from the 4th–5th c. CE, with a visitor center & tours.
name: Centro Arqueolóxico da Vila Romana de Toralla
address: 36390 36390, Rúa de Canido, 105, 36390 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Fundación Sales is a hidden gem, a botanical garden that offers a peaceful escape from the city. It may not be classified as a park, but it serves as a serene green oasis. Visitors can wander through diverse plant species and stroll across bridges that offer views of flowing streams. Many locals are unaware of this lovely spot, making it an ideal destination for those seeking tranquility.
name: Fundación Sales
address: de, Av. Europa, 52, 36212 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Praia Canido is a delightful and accessible seaside destination, unlike the unapproachable Island de Toralla located at the causeway's terminus. This pleasant small beach welcomes all members of the public, offering a charming coastal experience. In contrast, Island de Toralla remains off-limits to visitors. Praia Canido presents an ideal spot for relaxation and enjoyment along its picturesque shoreline, providing a refreshing alternative for those seeking sun, sand, and sea in a serene environment.
name: Praia Canido
address: Oia, 36390 Municipality of Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Located on a hilltop above Vigo, Monte dos Pozos is a restaurant offering authentic Spanish cuisine and scenic views of the town and sea. The spacious venue features ample outdoor seating and staff that are known for their friendly service. Start your meal with tapas such as calamari, mussels, and fried peppers. The generous portions are noteworthy, particularly the fried calamari that easily satisfies two people.
name: Restaurante Monte dos Pozos
address: Estrada do Freixo, 38, 36315 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

name: Miradoiro da Oliveira
address: P.º de Alfonso XII, 3, 36202 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: The Casa de las Artes is a captivating art museum that showcases a diverse collection of Galician artwork and historical photographs of Vigo. The Laxeiro exhibition, in particular, stands out as it features an array of significant pieces. The knowledgeable staff members provide insightful explanations about the artworks, ensuring visitors gain a deeper understanding of their significance. Admission to the museum is free, allowing everyone to appreciate the beautiful displays and immerse themselves in the world of art.
name: Casa de las Artes
address: Rúa Policarpo Sanz, 15, 36201 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

excerpt: Museum tracing Galician ethnographic history with a wide range of cultural & industrial artifacts.
detail_description: Museo Etnográfico Liste, situated in the heart of Vigo, is a museum that delves into the history of Galician ethnography. It boasts an extensive collection of over 2,000 cultural and industrial artifacts, including traditional clothing, footwear like wooden clogs, tools, medicines, and religious items. The museum offers interactive displays that provide insight into Spain's traditions and culture.
name: Museo Etnográfico Liste
address: Rúa Pastora, 22, Freixeiro, 36210 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Casino Vigo, also known as Gran Casino Vigo and Luckia Casino Vigo, is located within the A Laxe shopping center near the port. The casino is part of a complex designed by a renowned architect. Visitors can enjoy a variety of gaming machines and other entertainment options such as dining at the restaurant and attending shows and performances. Guests have praised the excellent service provided by the staff.
name: Casino Vigo Luckia
address: Rúa Cánovas del Castillo, 1, 36202 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

name: Paseo Marítimo de Bouzas
address: Rúa de Eduardo Cabello, 57, 36208 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

excerpt: Natural history museum featuring hands-on exhibits focused on space, the earth & human beings.
detail_description: Naturnova is a popular natural history museum in Vigo, attracting mostly locals eager to learn about space, the earth, and human beings. Divided into three sections focusing on the universe, biosphere, and environment, it offers hands-on exhibits and free tours on Saturday afternoons. Visitors can enjoy interactive experiences such as a submarine "simulation" and 3D glasses while exploring zones dedicated to planets, geology, and environmental topics.
name: Naturnova
address: Rúa Velázquez Moreno, 18, 20, Santiago de Vigo, 36202 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: The Pinacoteca Francisco Fernández del Riego is an intriguing exhibition center situated within the historic Pazo Arias Taboada. This venue, which boasts a well-preserved facade and heraldry, spans four floors, with the first floor currently open to visitors. One of the highlights at this museum is a holistic display featuring Manuel Colmeiro's captivating collection of oils and drawings. The informative staff also offers engaging master classes on the artist's work.
name: Pinacoteca Francisco Fernández del Riego
address: Rúa Abeleira Menéndez, 8, 36202 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: Gallery Selfie Vigo offers a unique and enjoyable experience for visitors. The well-decorated rooms are equipped with sounds and scents, creating an immersive atmosphere. Each room is designed for photo opportunities, featuring tripods and ring lights to capture the perfect selfie. It's recommended to visit in small groups to fully enjoy the experience without feeling crowded. Overall, it's a fun and cool place for group outings or even hosting parties.
name: Gallery Selfie Vigo
address: Rúa de Venezuela, 37, Santiago de Vigo, 36203 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: The Monumento a Elduayen is a tribute to an influential engineer and politician from Madrid. Situated in the Montero Rios Garden, this monument was unveiled in 1896 and features a pedestal designed in the Neo-Greek style by Jenaro de la Fuente. The pedestal includes four seated figures at its apex, symbolizing the four ministries Elduayen headed during his political career: Government, Finance, Overseas, and State Council.
name: Monumento a elduayen
address: Rúa Montero Ríos, 24, 36201 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain

detail_description: The Monumento aos Doantes de Órganos is a touching tribute to organ donors located in the heart of the city. It serves as a reminder of the selfless act of giving life to others through organ donation. The monument's design and location make it a serene place for contemplation and gratitude. Visitors can pay their respects and reflect on the profound impact of organ donation on individuals and communities.
name: Monumento aos Doantes de Órganos
address: 36202 Vigo, Pontevedra, Spain
